strategies.name: Social Proof
strategies.description: Build credibility through past work and client outcomes. Demonstrates relevant experience and proven track record to establish trust with potential clients.
examples: I recently completed a similar project for [client], delivering [specific outcome]...
In my last 5 projects in this domain, I achieved an average [metric] of [value]...
My portfolio includes work for [recognizable brands/companies] where I...
[Client testimonial quote] - [Client Name, Title]
strategies.best_for: Projects where you have highly relevant past experience and can reference specific outcomes or recognizable clients

strategies.name: Contrarian Approach
strategies.description: Challenge conventional approaches and offer a differentiated perspective. Positions you as a critical thinker who goes beyond surface-level solutions.
examples: Most freelancers would approach this by [common method], but I'd take a different angle: [your approach]...
The typical solution here is [X], but based on my experience, that often leads to [problem]. Here's what I'd do instead...
I noticed your job post mentions [approach]. Have you considered that this might actually [potential issue]? Here's an alternative...
Rather than following the standard playbook, I'd recommend [unconventional strategy] because...
strategies.best_for: Clients who have tried multiple approaches unsuccessfully, or projects where conventional solutions have clear limitations

strategies.name: Immediate Value
strategies.description: Lead with actionable insights or specific observations about their project. Demonstrates expertise by providing value upfront before being hired.
examples: I noticed three specific improvements that could boost your [metric]: [1], [2], [3]...
Looking at your [asset/codebase/existing work], I spotted [specific issue] which is likely causing [problem]. Here's how to fix it...
Quick win: You could increase [outcome] by 20% just by [specific tactical suggestion]...
I analyzed your [deliverable] and created a brief audit. The top priority should be...
strategies.best_for: Projects where you can quickly identify issues or opportunities from publicly available information

strategies.name: Problem-Aware
strategies.description: Demonstrate deep understanding of the underlying challenges and pain points. Shows empathy and domain expertise by articulating problems the client may not have fully expressed.
examples: The challenge you're describing usually stems from [root cause]. Here's why that happens and how to address it...
I've seen this issue before - it typically means [diagnosis]. The real problem is [deeper issue], not just [surface symptom]...
Based on your job post, you're likely also dealing with [related challenge]. Here's the pattern I've observed...
The reason [their approach] isn't working is probably because [insight about their context]...
strategies.best_for: Complex projects where demonstrating deep domain understanding is critical, or when the job post suggests underlying frustrations

strategies.name: Question-Based
strategies.description: Open with thoughtful questions that reveal expertise and start a consultative conversation. Shows you understand the nuances and won't jump to premature solutions.
examples: Before diving in, I'd love to understand: what does success look like for this project in 6 months?
Have you already tried [common approach]? If so, what specific results did you see?
To propose the right solution, I need to clarify: is your primary goal [A] or [B]? They require very different approaches...
Quick question: are you looking to [approach 1] or [approach 2]? The answer will shape my entire recommendation...
strategies.best_for: Projects with ambiguous requirements, or when building a consultative relationship is more important than quick answers
